etymology.type: Ideogrammic compound (会意) [医]; Phono-semantic compound (形声) [醫]
etymology.description: 医: ideogrammic — 匸 “that which hides/stores” + 矢 “arrow”. 醫: phono-semantic — semantic 酉 “liquor” + phonetic 殹.
etymology.interpretation: In 医, an enclosed arrow evokes treating or extracting arrows from wounds, hence healing. In 醫, the wine vessel hints at alcohol used in remedies, while 殹 contributes the sound.
etymology.simplification: PRC simplification adopted the older ideogram 医, dropping the 酉 ‘liquor’ and the phonetic 殹 from 醫 to reduce strokes and reflect an ancient form.

examples.chinese: 她是经验丰富的医生(她是經驗豐富的醫生)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì jīngyàn fēngfù de yīshēng.

examples.chinese: 我在医院接受治疗(我在醫院接受治療)。
examples.english: I received treatment at the hospital.

examples.chinese: 中医强调调养与预防(中醫強調調養與預防)。
examples.english: Traditional Chinese medicine emphasizes nurturing and prevention.
